website_summaries.verdict: Soft, gentle, non-irritating wipes loved by parents from a trusted brand.
pros: Mild wipes with excellent level of moisture and softness
Parents say they can use fewer wipes with this brand, and also praise them for their thickness
Some also felt the wipe size is a bit larger than other brands
cons: A few felt the packaging ripped too easily
may not work for all babies' skin

website_summaries.verdict: Hypoallergenic types of baby wipes that maintain the natural Ph balance in the skin.
pros: No perfume or alcohol in the wipes, which makes them safe to use on kids of all ages
Can handle big cleaning jobs well while using fewer wipes
cons: May cause additional stinging feeling if baby already has diaper rash

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great until they changed packaging
customer_reviews.text: They’re my favorite wipes. Your finger won’t go through them. I very anmoyined that they no onger have the little resealable sticker on the top, so you can use the package without a dispenser. I need to carry more wipes than the little travel dispensers, but don’t want a giant plastic tub filling my diaper bag either. These were great until they removed the little clear resealable tab. I am not purchasing the over priced pop top ones either.
customer_reviews.author: Dannygirl

customer_reviews.title: Missing one key thing
customer_reviews.text: I normally love these wipes, but I just purchased 2 large boxes, each containing 9 refill packs, and all the packages of wipes are missing the seal/sticker that you can remove and reseal after each use to prevent the wipes from drying out. I use the wipes to refill my wipe container, however I also use them on the go and bring an entire package with me when traveling or in the diaper bag (times when I don't want to bring the big, plastic container). Well, because the wipes are missing the seal I have to keep them in a plastic bag to prevent from drying out. A real pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.author: scb

customer_reviews.title: Great wipes but packaging change is no good!
customer_reviews.text: I love these wipes and have used them for both of my children. The refill packages are usually super convenient until this latest package. Pampers has eliminated the reclosable seal and now tells you to cut the package open, which we all know causes the wipes to dry out before you can use them all. I am not happy about this change as I can't stand the boxes that you have to buy to keep the wipes from drying out. They went cheap on the packaging yet kept the same price.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Different packaging, not good
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the wipes many times, and was satisfied with its quality. However, the recent packaging I received needs to be opened at sides, which has no resealable plastic as it used to have, and makes the wipes dry out quickly. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia C.

customer_reviews.title: Poor design change to packaging
customer_reviews.text: I used to get these on Subscribe and Save which I have now cancelled. Terrible idea by the Pampers team to remove the resealable sticker on the top of wipes package. Now I have to have a pair of scissors nearby when I change my childrens’ diapers if I run out during a change. This is what happens when you let the bean counters run your company.
customer_reviews.author: dbong9

customer_reviews.title: couldn’t be happier
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews were showing these with the standard sticky peeling opening but these showed up with the hard plastic one, couldn’t be happier
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Turn refill packs into flip tops with empty flip top pouch lids!
customer_reviews.text: My order came with half a box of flip top and the other half were refill packs. I dont buy the refill packs because I do not have a platic wipe tub. But it was easy to peel the flio top off of an empty pouch and glue it onto a refill pack and just cut a hole to make it a flip top. Pampers sensitive wipes are so soft and gentle. They are perfect for my daughter's sensitive skin. I also love the thickness.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Packaging
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always ordered these with no issue. The last order I received the wipe packages had no opening on top and need to be cut open and placed in a container which is very inconvenient. No longer ordering these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crappy packaging
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like being in the middle of a crappy diaper change (pun intended) and discovering pampers had changed their packaging! I had to rip the package down the side, wipes flying everywhere, praying my baby didn’t roll over since his poopy butt was already exposed...you used to be able to open these with one hand, not anymore. If you don’t plan on toting around the bulky plastic container to refill...don’t waste your time. You know what’s even crappier, my subscribe and save has already processed so I’ll be stuck with another box of useless wipes :(
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Schell

customer_reviews.title: I hate them
customer_reviews.text: I hate these wipes. They're not wet enough, there's no texture to them, I don't think they need a smell, they're hard to get into, they over lap too much so they're hard to pull out of the box. I thought I was buying the pure aqua version. Which I don't love but at least they're wet and unscented. I'm going through these as fast as I can so that we can buy the kind we like. I also noticed he got a rash after starting these. It was mild and went away quickly but he never got them before we started using these.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: not a bargain anymore
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in early 2018. I try to buy in bulk when I can, and have storage space for the item. These are the only wet-wipe I can use, as there is an aloe allergy in my house-hold. When I bought them in early 2019, I was comparing the boxes they arrived in. Guess what? Corporate America strikes again! In the first box there were 582 sheets. In the new box there are 504 sheets. Seventy-eight sheets less for the same price. Oh, even thousands of years ago, the Romans said "Caveat emptor" --" Let the buyer beware!" So, beware of these nasty little tricks big corporations visit upon the middle class. Sometimes you can't win.
customer_reviews.author: Myra

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just got my box of 864 total wipes . So far so good . I’ve been using this brand since my daughter was born and I compared it to the packs I buy at the stores and so far it’s pretty legit . The reward codes work so that’s a good thing. Smells exactly like store packaging ( I know it sounds wierd but they have this type of smell ) . I didn’t use it yet but I’ve read reviews stating that there are some moldy wipes so we’ll see . I’ll do a review update if I have any problems with it but so far pretty legit and good price for the amount of wipes .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How has 2 free hands and sissors while changing poop.
customer_reviews.text: So sad Pampers made this change. Apparently some genius who has never changed a diaper thinks I have 2 free hands and a pair of scissors while I am wrangling a nasty poop covered baby, or wresting a toddler. Not cool!!! I have been a Pampers devotee for over 4 years (multiple kids in diapers) I use to order 2 cases a month. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Dantes

customer_reviews.title: Almost overpowering scent..
customer_reviews.text: As far as the softest wipe I've ever used, this beats them all! I absolutely love it. It's great for sensitive skin too but it says they are unscented but they in fact have a chemical/clean smell to them in my opinion, they don't stink but they definitely don't smell good either! and when in contact with body fluids... yuck! The scent gets worse! I don't know what it is or even how to describe the smell but if it wasn't for that I would have 100% given five stars! For the value they are great wipes and the softest ones I've ever used! But I expected unscented not whatever this is...
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Refill packages inside! Not Pop-tops! Pay attention before you buy!
customer_reviews.text: Product is good. However, Pampers sells refill packages instead of Pop-top packages in Amazon, which I need to get a refill tub. This is really sad especially when you are running out the wipes for your baby! And this cannot be returned! The description did not tell the difference clearly! I found there are several reviews which have the same situation. Really disappointed about Pampers and I will try other products instead!
customer_reviews.author: AwesomeQQ

customer_reviews.title: These Burn Irritated Skin!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure what is supposed to be sensitive about these wipes. My son would say “hurts!” when I would use these when he had a rash. I thought maybe I was wiping too hard but then I used these on my hands and had a paper cut and it BURNED like crazy. Like it was very very painful! I can’t even imagine how much it hurts on a diaper rash.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed with packaging change
customer_reviews.text: The wipes themselves are great but I have been ordering them for 1.5 years and Pampers stopped making them with the peel open top. This is infuriating and makes them worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn League

customer_reviews.title: Soft, gentle, and unscented
customer_reviews.text: I've used these since my son was born, and even after he's 'grown up' to wipe hands/noses/surfaces throughout the house with. I love that they're unscented as I have trouble with perfumes, and he has sensitive skin that can react to perfumes, soaps (drying), and adhesives, and this is gentle and doesn't bother either of us. Also, it's good to wipe down mishaps (chocolate from donuts on chair, whatever). I only wish someone would come up with a great traveling pack that's sturdy and small, and doesn't crack (like the plastic tubs), as I keep them in the car and suitcase as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Duncan

customer_reviews.title: No plastic tab -- not resealable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for a long time and they have always had a plastic tab so they are resealable. It says on the box they are refills but without they tab I have to cut a hole in the top so they work as refills in the plastic tubs. This was a reorder and I expected the same product but these do not have the tab so they are not resealable. Too bad -- I think they have "improved" the product and will lose customers. PAMPERS: You had a five star product. Now you have a one star product and have driven a customer to another product.
customer_reviews.author: sam325

customer_reviews.title: Fake/Counterfeit Pampers Products
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT Pampers products, and should not be advertised as such. I was extremely disappointed to find that upon entering in the Pampers product code in my Pampers Rewards App, none of them were authentic. Upon further inspection of the packaging I realized the entire box of wipes was in fact fake/counterfeit. What is odd, is that this item says “ships from and sold by Amazon”.... so does that mean Amazon itself is actually purchasing (or manufacturing) fake Pampers products, and then selling them to people under the guise of false advertising? Or is there an unnamed 3rd party involved, that I have not been able to find any information on....?
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W.

customer_reviews.title: No No No - Caused Diaper Rash
customer_reviews.text: I had been buying another brand of expensive natural wipes and wanted to see if Pampers Sensitive could replace our current choice. My son's poor bottom had diaper rash all over it after the first day using these. These may be labelled sensitive, but they sure aren't gentle. I stopped using them and decided to keep using the pricey wipes. I didn't have a problem with the quality of the wipe itself, but otherwise these struck out big time.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Boxes say if they are pop tops. Refill boxes are not pop tops.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used these yet as baby is due in February. But I've used pampers wipes in the past. I love that these are pop tops. A little disappointed that I didn't get as many points in the Pampers rewards as I did with a previous box. The previous box I got from a local store gave me 60 points for the first pack and 10 additional points for each pack. This one didn't give me the 60 points for the first pack. But hey.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Holland

customer_reviews.title: Practice the SAME TENETS OF HYGIENE....Wash your hands well/vigorously with Soap and Warm Water.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for those individuals like myself and my Mom to practice hand hygiene even in this age of EVERYTHING AUTOMATED!!!! I'm a Registered Nurse in Norcal so was already well stocked up..,but my darling 71yo Mom with HTN/DMII is also my 1° Caregiver, now that I've succumbed to my genetic horrible red blood disease of mine. I've pretty much spent this year laid up in a hospital bed and you need to remind people (educated no less) that 3 more Bounty Tissues never stopped the transmission, infection and course prognosis of any virulent or bacterial infectious diseases !!!!! 🙉🙈🙊😷🤒🤕🤧🤮🥵😴🤓🧐👩🏾‍⚕️👩‍🔬👩‍🦯👩‍🦼🧘🏾‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These work okay
customer_reviews.text: I personally like the huggies wipes better because they are a little stronger for when there’s a tough poop diaper, but decided to give these a try since all I use are pampers diapers, the material is a little more scratchy than the huggies wipes and they also do dry out much faster. But the good things about them is they don’t irritate babies skin (neither do my huggies either though) at all and as long as they stay moist they work well. Also shame on ppl buying these that don’t have babies to take care of, I feel for the mothers having to do without wipes for their babies during this time.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy! Wipes Shed!
customer_reviews.text: The wipes are just not something I like. AT ALL. They are hard to get out of the package. You will 90% of the time pull out at least 5 and have to smush them all back in the package. My biggest concern is the material. It gets ALL OVER my child. Every single pack I have has done this. I have to sit there for a while pulling all this fuzz out of every crevice of my child’s private parts. Like what?! Who wants to do that? Plus I don’t want my child to get an infection. I can’t imagine the bacteria with all this fuzz sitting. It’s ridiculous. SUPER displeased. Will NOT buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Davia

customer_reviews.title: Best for sensitive babies but keep using them as they get older
customer_reviews.text: These wipes do work better for sensitive babies so I just kept using them and I really prefer the better ingredients. It had always bothered me that they put a lot of scent and unneeded ingredients in something you use on your baby several times a day and I have not found that any of the latest gourmet hypoallergenic brands work as well. Always stick with Pampers.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M. Gasper

customer_reviews.title: Causes skin irritaton
customer_reviews.text: We will not be using these wipes anymore. I originally subscribed to them because they were pampers...a trusted brand and for sensitive skin. My daughter had little blisters around her bottom And I could never figure out what the culprit was. I tried many creams, different diapers, steroid cream, and could not get it to clear. I ended up trying hello Bello wipes, bought one pack and her rash improved immediately, and after that one pack it was completely gone. We won’t be using them anymore 🙁 sadly because I have a case and 1/2 left, but I can’t use them after discovering this.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Burned 13mo Bottom
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used water wipes since my son was born and figured at 13 months we could try these. The wipes burned his entire bottom, everywhere we’ve wiped him and all the creases they touched. Never had a problem with water wipes. We thought we were being dramatic so yesterday we went back to water wipes and it was getting better. Today my husband used these again after the last nap and my son is crying and his whole bottom is red again like it was yesterday. He doesn’t have sensitive skin, so we thought that was a nice option shifting from water wipes to something else. Nope.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Awful “new” packaging
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used Pampers refills (specifically the sensitive wipes) for a year and half now and we’re shocked of the new and horrible packaging decision Pampers made!!! The new packaging is not convenient at all! It’s a ridiculous cost savings measure and Pampers needs to return to the previous packaging!! Keep spreading the word and maybe they will get the hint!
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: It's wash rags for us, I guess!!
customer_reviews.text: I like these wipes because they seem to be the only ones my babies are not allergic to. However, I can no longer purchase them because the people who bought up all the toilet paper likely caused others to buy out all the baby wipes. They needed something to wipe their own adult bums with, leaving none for actual babies. So, thank you to all you fine people out there, who made all these wipes disappear and/or so expensive that I cannot afford them anymore for my babies. Love these wipes, but can't purchase anymore...literally.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymously anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Baby must-have! Great wipes!
customer_reviews.text: I used Pampers wipes and diapers with my 20 year old daughter and now these are the only baby wipes we use on our 17 month old daughter. I like that they are unscented and gentle on her skin. This is also a great value for the money! 12 packs of wipes for around $25 is great! There are 4 refill packs for wipes tubs and 8 pop top wipes packages. I prefer the pop top wipes from this package because they have an improved opening so only one wipe comes out at a time. The old packaging was different and the wipes came out in bunches. So these are great! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly R.

customer_reviews.title: Rash!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this brand of wipes since baby was born. This was the first time I bought them off Amazon and my baby got a terrible rash. After almost 3 weeks I finally decided to change wipes and it cleared up within days! I wish I could send these back but I’ve already used almost all of them. The remainder will be going in the trash! I don’t know if maybe the wipes were not stored correctly they did not appear to have mold on them but something was definitely up with this batch. I will not be buying wipes off amazon again and don’t recommend it for others.
customer_reviews.author: Camelia

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: I honestly wouldn’t buy these ever again due to the fact that they no longer have a flip top. Obviously when I ordered them I didn’t realize this... so when I got my box and saw they just had a weird type of sticky tape covering the opening hole I came back to check... how did I miss that when I ordered them????? So I came back to check and realized that in the pictures it doesn’t show the top of the wipe package at all.. which makes sense how I may have seemed to miss that.. but that’s a huge deal breaker for me.. I will never buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: These get the job done but I prefer the value and quality of Costco’s brand better. Better bang for the buck there but these are my second choice for their price point. Was forced to get these because they were the only ones available to buy with the Coronavirus depleting everyone else’s supply
customer_reviews.author: James Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Will not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: new packaging requires scissors to open the package and load the wipes into a container. The sticker and opening on top was removed! How can I do all that with a squirming baby on a changing table?! Guess i'll be switching brands.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Alaska Burr

customer_reviews.title: There are better wipes
customer_reviews.text: For a back up wipes, these are OK. I think they’ve changed the ingredients to the wipe and they don’t seem as moist to me. I also have to use two or more each dirty diaper in order to make sure my little one is clean. When using a refill tub, and they do not come out easily and dry out super fast. They aren’t the worst wipe, but I’ve used better and will be switching brands. As far as a wipe for sensitivity, I think these are just fine. Both myself and my children have sensitive skin and they don’t seem to irritate them at all.
customer_reviews.author: I’m a Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Not pop tops
customer_reviews.text: Ordered because these were listed as pop top packs. They aren’t. People are looking for specific things when shopping online and a broad “packaging may vary” slapped in the description shouldn’t mean you can ship whatever you’ve got. Meaning if you’ve advertised these as pop tops don’t mail me packs with stickers over the opening. The experience using one over the other is different and they are produced for different reasons. The wipes themselves are fine, but I was disappointed with what I received. Subscription cancelled.
customer_reviews.author: Katie TPot

customer_reviews.title: Not overly impressed except for softness
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of stars given my rating on the specific elements listed. My minor complaints have to do with they seem slightly dry based on the first packages opened. Another complaint is that they clump togetherwhen being extracted from the packaging so several pull out at once. Many reviewers claimed they pulled out one by one better than other brand wipes. Finally the stickem label covering the extraction hole is not very sticky and does not seal well to keep remaining wipes moist. I’ve already added water to one pack of wipes to remoisten them. Bottom Line: We are less joyful with this purchase than expected to be based on product claims and positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Skyeisle

customer_reviews.title: Not Resealable Anymore!
customer_reviews.text: These no longer have the convienient resealable flap. Once you open, they are open and will dry out if not placed in a tub. Changed without notifying customers.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Samick

customer_reviews.title: BEST BABY WIPE!
customer_reviews.text: Pampers sensitive baby wipes are the best choice for your baby's skin. The clinically proven, hypoallergenic wipe comes from a well trusted brand that can leave parents feeling confident they are providing their baby with the best cleansing product. The gentle formula ensures that newborn skin is protected and that the wipes can be used on small faces and hands. Pampers sensitive wipes are very affordable and come in a multitude of sizes. Pampers users can sign up for Pampers Points and get credit for every Pampers purchase to redeem for rewards from their catalog. I have exclusively used Pampers on all three of my children and HIGHLY recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brad klingensmith/Nickie Flickinger

customer_reviews.title: Good wipes but terrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy Huggies wipes but I decided to try this for a change. The wipes itself is good, soft, with good amount of moisture and no scent. However, the wipes come out in bulk (2,3 at the same time) and I have to put some back in, and the opening ripped open after a few uses. And then the sticker to close the opening does not stick anymore after a few days. And because of this, the wipes loose their moisture. it is important for wipes to stay moist and also should be easy to take out especially when needed in emergency like when a poop drama happens with the little one. So I do not recommend these wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Khanu’s Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Falsely advertised beware!
customer_reviews.text: These are falsely advertised. They show the pop up dispenser on the wipes but what you are really getting are the packs without the pop up convenient dispenser. Not happy about that! This site wouldn’t allow me to review the product without at least 1 Star otherwise I would have given none. I do not believe in false advertisement! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: sci247

customer_reviews.title: A lot of wasted wipes due to poor packaging.
customer_reviews.text: These diapers wipes will do the job. They are soft to touch, and the scent not terrific but not offensive These do work on sensitive skin without causing further irritation or rash. These are the issues I have found in comparing them to the brand I usually use. They are thin. It take 2-3 wipes instead of one wipe like I was used to using. Two at most. The container they come in does not stay closed and usually the top wipe is wasted if it has been longer than 5-6 hours between uses. And lastly when you pull the wipe out two or three come. So waste is my main complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Hope❤️

customer_reviews.title: Good product horrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this product. Number one you can’t seal it properly the packaging is very flimsy. So far I’ve opened 3. Two have torn. The little flimsy plastic thing they have to go over the top doesn’t stick after a few uses. The other problem you can’t pull one out at a time. I have used wipes through my children, my grandchildren and now I am 70 and I still use them for myself personally. This may be a good product but the packaging ruins it. Because you waste your money pulling six out at a time and the rest of the product drys up because you can’t close it properly.
customer_reviews.author: R. S.

customer_reviews.title: No longer have a resealable seal.
customer_reviews.text: Have been buying pampers wipes for years. Used to think they were great until they stopped putting the resealable sticker on the top of the pack. Now they’re harder to get open and If I’m taking them out with me I need more than fits in a travel box.
customer_reviews.author: John Rayner

customer_reviews.title: 7 packs not 9
customer_reviews.text: That changed. Package now consists of 7 pop up packs 504 counts of wipes. Used to be 9 pop up packs
customer_reviews.author: Islandd

customer_reviews.title: I stand "behind" this product
customer_reviews.text: I'm kind of a diaper and wipes snob...I don't like strongly scented things so this is nice for me...there are enough smells going on at diaper time, if you know what I'm saying...it's also nice because we have to send in community wipes to my sons daycare and there are a few kids in his class with skin things going on so it makes me feel better knowing they can use these. My son has only had a diaper rash maybe twice and it has gone away relatively quickly. I credit my diaper and wipe snobbery...I like getting them in bulk and this has been on auto order for me for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Sayard E. Bass

customer_reviews.title: These wipes are terrible
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst wipes I have ever used. There is nothing good about these wipes. The packaging is terrible. The wipe on top is always unusable because the top doesn’t close and the first wipe always dries out. The wipes do not clean my daughter. After wiping her butt you can use a cottonball with some mustela water and see that the wipes do not clean all the way. There will be some brown/yellow on the cottonball. My daughter has developed a rash because the wipes have not been cleaning well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Dora Negoro

customer_reviews.title: Excellent substitute for Wet Ones !
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on these because I could not find Wet Ones Sensitive, which I have been using for years. Guess the virus has caused people to stock up on the Wet Ones, but really, these are softer, stronger, nicer in every way. I'm sticking with them. They pull out easily and have no alcohol or offensve odor. I put the package into an old Pampers plastic storage container which I still had from my babysitting grandma days. Just remember, please do not flush! They do not disintegrate and will clog up your plumbing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Grube

customer_reviews.title: Soft. Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Look at yall straight trippin on the packaging change. I have never seen such a bunch of entitled pansies in my whole life. So u cut a hole in the top and put thee entire package inside your travel pouch. Thats what I do. Actually keeps them all much wetter. In the home warmer dispenser cut a little hole in thee entire package and put the whole thing in. Yall act like you dont even own a pair of scissors. Its so hectic in your life that a four second prep on wipes is not possible. Lol. Seriously tho. These are the best wipes available and the only ones that dont irritate my babies' skin.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A. Pedro

customer_reviews.title: This is not the product you searched for!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I searched and thought i had found flushable wipes. What i got was nonflushable and when you wipe they break up into lint and fibers. That is definitely not good on my sensitive skin. Amazon fix your search to allow each word use to exclude options. Pampers if this is how you treat babies you need to rethink your whole existence!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes
customer_reviews.text: Pampers wipes for sensitive skin are the best wipes! We have tried Parenta choice (smell sort of pickle-like even though they claim I scented, we tried Huggies... which are sort of dry to be honest (even though a Huggies diapers are THE best) m, we tried Honest co, and those are some good wipes also, water wipes are nice too... but our family favorite are definitely these pampers sensitive skin wipes. I am so grateful that friends and family gifted us a variety to try, but these are the winners!! I scented as advertised, super soft, wet enough but not too we, and overall a great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Package is not resealable which leads to the wipes drying out.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered these wipes for over 3 years. All of a sudden the package has changed and they are no longer resealable. Now I have to put them in a ziplock to prevent them from drying out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bring back resealable refills
customer_reviews.text: I love pampers sensitive wipes but I am disappointed with the packaging on the refill packs. I always get the 1024 box, but a few months ago they took off the resealable tape on the refill packs. I wouldn't complain if it at least included a storage container to store them in, but they don't. I now have to resort to making a big cut at the top and putting tape so they won't dry. I really hope they make them resealable again. It's also hard to buy the containers by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Aken

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to open as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Pampers sensitive wipes for both of my children and loved them. They were easy to open and gentle on my babies. But they have changed the way the package of wipes is opened. Now you have to use scissors to open the wipe package. Most moms know you run out while your little is in the middle of being changed. Who has scissors right by to open. And now we can take them with us without the plastic case. Before it was so handy having the resealable slot to take with you.
customer_reviews.author: Michele D. Gasper

customer_reviews.title: The worst
customer_reviews.text: The actual container that holds the wipes is the worst I've ever come across in 8 years of wipage. The opening only has a non-sticky sticker to reseal after you've opened. The sticker is useless but it doesn't even get a chance to try working because as soon as you pull the first wipe out of the hole, 20 others attempt to follow it which results in a tear as large as the package. Within the first 3 uses max, you'll either be throwing it all away because they're dried out or putting them in a Ziploc bag to save the moisture. Worst wipes ever, coming from someone who never complains. Dollar Tree wipes are 100x better.
customer_reviews.author: George k.

customer_reviews.title: Just a 1st times dad review
customer_reviews.text: Wipes overall work great, item definitely as described. only problem i have is that these wipes have the "sticker cover" instead of a "locking cover" like on other brands. So once u uncover the sticker and pull out the wipe u have to use that same sticker to cover the wipe back up to protect them from drying. If that sticker cover gets a little dirty it wont work right, and when in a rush changing diapers its easy to accidentally not close the sticker cover all the way and toss the wipes back into my diaper bag to later find out i got some dry wipes. :( so minus 1 star for that.
customer_reviews.author: Papi dragon

customer_reviews.title: Soft yet strong
customer_reviews.text: These baby wipe are soft on my baby's body and especially his sensitive bottom. I use this on almost everything including wiping my yorkie who has environmental allergies. I haven't been afraid of it ripping or tearing. I love that it has no scent. My son has learn not to cry while I approach him after he has "eaten". Eating for a 6 month old is more of "how can I smear this everywhere and anywhere and avoid it going into my mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect description
customer_reviews.text: I only gave four stars due to the fact that the different amount options come in different packaging. For instance the 300+ wipes come with the hard plastic closing while the 500+ just have the resealable soft plastic. This was not clear in the description. Overall the wipes are great, but by purchasing the larger amount I had to buy a wipes tub so they do not dry out as quick. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Thick yet soft.
customer_reviews.text: My newborn has very sensitive skin and will turn red/start to rash easily. Huggies wipes seem to be too rough/scratchy or him. I was worried these would be thin and useless but they are soft and thick! I got the new package and I dont mind it. Yes the cut is smaller but I can still grab wipes easily. I actually think the smaller hole works because often I find myself struggling to separate the wipes in the bigger hole because too many come out at once. I'm rather happy with these. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lilybud

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I actually use these for cleaning my dog's paws when she comes indoors. She's a yorkie. They are first of all a great value, the price for the quantity and the packaging is great. I was very happy with it. Then I'd have to say the quality is pretty great too as they stand up fantastically to my cleaning her paws and don't tear on her nails. They clean up The dirt, mud, etc really well, absorbing it without getting it all over my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Hated it
customer_reviews.text: Very good brand, charges a "good" price for that but the plastic bag is really CHEAP and I hated it. You open the top to take the wipes and most of the times it tears all part around the "hole". Your wipes gets dry because lf this. Omg I was soooooo happy when they finally finished. I swear to God, it was a terrible experience. Being this GOOD AND EXPENSIVE brand, the material for the wrap bag was so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Silva

customer_reviews.title: Good wipes but not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for its quality but I'm give three stars for the ease of use. As indicated, this is a refill for wipe boxes. The ones I got do have a sticky plastic seal for people who want to use without a pop up box, but it's very hard to keep the top wipe wet because of the seal. Also it is very hard to separate wipes from one another especially when you are changing a diaper and only have one hand available. This product needs to rethink how to design for ease of use!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: the only ones I'll use
customer_reviews.text: I won't buy another brand, because once I switched to these, I seen how much softer and more effective they are. However, some of the stores are usually out of this brand, which is why I try to keep stocked up with subscribe and save. Running out and having to buy another brand doesn't go so well. Pampers is by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: Shlyre

customer_reviews.title: Great but hate how it was shipped
customer_reviews.text: I love how I could get wipes from the seller what I didnt like was how it was shipped. Given the hard times going on right now the product was shipped in it's own pampers wipe box shown to everyone so anyone in need of wipes around our neighborhood couldve easily known that we had this on our doorstep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing A

customer_reviews.title: > Toilet paper
customer_reviews.text: Ive only been using these for a month and i have to say baby wipes are the way to go. Ya want a nice clean experience when you wipe look no further. Mild sent enough to eliminate any lingering odor, wipes are pretty strong too so much so the odds of accidentally ripping them are near impossible. I say these are good for all ages and most means. Excellent value too really cant be beat, just remember no flushing these wipes go in the trash
customer_reviews.author: Rex T. Paradox

customer_reviews.title: Great wipes, except.
customer_reviews.text: Great wipes, except. Feel like Amazon could’ve done a better job of packaging this inside another box because by the time I receive the wipes the box was completely busted and bent and I actually store these so I have back ups and the box is just ruined other than that love these wipes.
customer_reviews.author: britt

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin:)
customer_reviews.text: I just received these today. I have been using these Pampers wipes since my baby was a newborn (She is 10 months today!) Never had an issue with these. I have tried a lot of different brands and they made my baby red but not these ones.:) Pampera please don't change these like your diapers. These wipes rock. I was nervous about order ing this 9 pack of refills because I read the reviews after I purchased them and saw about having to use scissors to rip them open but I recieved the ones that have the pull tab that can re-seal. Thank goodness:) I am set for a while on wipes now😀
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Packaging change.  No pop top
customer_reviews.text: I am not happy with the order change. My subscribe and save wipes did have the pop top. These I just received do not! And says they are refills. Just what am I suppose to refill them into?? They will not stay sealed now. Very unhappy with packaging change.
customer_reviews.author: Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: Not a closeable top. Just the ones with a sticker to seal them.
customer_reviews.text: Normally I’d give pampers wipes a 5 but these ones in particular kind of suck because they’re not the ones with a top you can close. They just have a sticker so they can call them “refills”. I keep forgetting and ordering them and then I’m kicking myself because every time I use them they don’t get closed properly and the top one or two dry out. Hopefully next time I’ll remember and order the ones with the close top.
customer_reviews.author: Kellymn

customer_reviews.title: No longer resealable
customer_reviews.text: This last batch had a package change that no longer allows you to seal the top of the package of wipes shut. Your options are to use with a wipe holder or let them dry out. Really horrible design change.
customer_reviews.author: DID

customer_reviews.title: Horrible packing
customer_reviews.text: we use the wipes for my baby. we weren't aware of the packing change otherwise we would have continued with the huggies ones. There is no doubt about the quality of the wipes. But, packet seal doesn't close properly after few days drying out half of the wipes. We used about 50% of 1st packet but am not sure we can return it. Lessons learned, we would stick with the better packing ones going forward. Wish, I had read the recent reviews before placing the order..
customer_reviews.author: Pavan

customer_reviews.title: Amazon needs to get their orders right
customer_reviews.text: These are the only wipes I’ve been using for the last 10 years. My kids are elementary age now, but I still buy these wipes for when we’re traveling, or for when I have little ones at my house. Why 4 stars? I ordered 12 pop up tops. 5 out of 12 were wrong packaging, they were the refill packs that have to be completely ripped. Disappointed as I won’t be able use these for travel or on the go.
customer_reviews.author: ChooseLove

customer_reviews.title: Should have stayed with the water based wipes
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are awful. They arent very wet, first of all, and arent as effective at cleaning. I noticed the diapers stick to my baby's bum after I started using these, which does not help any sensitivity she may have. Finally, they stick to each other so when I go to pull out one, I get six and the strand still won't break. One hand on baby, one hand to get wipes... means several wipes end up on the floor. What a waste, cant wait to finish this box and buy new.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith A. Short

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVORITE
customer_reviews.text: these are my favorite and I wont use anything else. The nice thing is, is you get a TON of wipes for a great price and it ships directly to you. The thing to be aware of is that about 4 of the packs of wipes are just replacement wipes meaning that it usually goes in one of those hard plastic wipe boxes. other than that. I will continue to buy this until my son stops needing wipes!
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: New packaging change is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: New packaging change is terrible. Please bring back the resealable sticker top. Yes, they're refill wipes and a pop-top is offered, but who wants to have to order two types of wipes (one for the dispenser and one for the diaper bag/daycare). The sticker top was the perfect middle ground. It wasted less plastic than buying only pop-top, but was good enough for diaper bags and daycare. Who wants to tear/cut a package mid diaper change! Also, the packaging still shows the sticker top in the directions and is virtually indistinguishable from the old sticker too, which is confusing and misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Good wipes,Bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: I like the wipes,they are very soft and comfort,it can clean dirty very well. But, I don't really like the packaging. It makes the wipes dry quickly-This is still acceptable because it only make the top one very dry ,the rest are still moist. BUT!! The part I hate - they are sticky with each other! It is so hard to just pull one piece of wipe out,each time it comes out with 4-5 pieces together which causes an extra waste.That's why I rate 3 star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buying in bulk on Amazon is great, until they change the size and price on ...
customer_reviews.text: Buying in bulk on Amazon is great, until they change the size and price on subscribe and save. We used the sensitive wipes from the time our newborn came home until he was just over 2. No rashes, breakouts, etc. they’re always damp enough, and the packages close so much better than those other “save the earth” or Seventh Generation wipes. If it gets the poo off cleanly, then it’s doing the right job.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Horrible packaging on otherwise great wipes!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What possible reason do you have to make this new packaging other than forcing people to get your more expensive pop tops packs??? These wipes are excellent and have been using them for a very long time. However, recently I got these with the new packaging that led to quite big of disappointment. 1) Can’t use them without carrying an extra dispenser. 2) Can’t open them without using scissors! Just pathetic packaging design all around. FIX IT PAMPERS!
customer_reviews.author: H.S.

customer_reviews.title: Do not work well!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to remove baby’s bowel movements and clean the skin well without using so many! Hardly moist and simply do not work well. I personally love Huggies Natural Wipes and only ordered these because Huggies was sold out. Ordering Huggies now and giving away the rest of my pampers wipes. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Bird

customer_reviews.title: linty
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using this product and expected it to be good quality since it’s pampers. However it is so linty...when I use it to wipe any surfaces, there’s left over lint from the towels. I wouldn’t use this on my baby if I had one..
customer_reviews.author: Mundy

customer_reviews.title: The packages don’t seal
customer_reviews.text: Poor packaging makes great product worthless. This is a great product. I thought they’d come with the plastic snap closure that keeps them fresh. They have the peel off sticker so unless you plan to go through an entire pack in a day or two they will dry out and be worthless. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Barry S. Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t come out good
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible. It is difficult to get just one at a time, usually I pull out two or three because of the way they are folded together, then proceed to shake the heck out of them to get them to separate while I’m holding baby legs up with the other hand and they flip all over the place. They are a nice big size though. But The top one ends up drying out between changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price for the brand name and quality
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy generic wipes but then switched to these. They. Are. Awesome. You can definitely feel a difference in the wipe thickness and softness. They smell great and leave my babies skin soft and clean. They do not irritate him and he hasn’t had any rashes. I open the package completely and put them in my wipe holder so it doesn’t bother me that it has a soft opening and closure. I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Tigers

customer_reviews.title: I prefer Huggies this will do this time.
customer_reviews.text: I must say i prefer Huggies all things baby. I purchased this product bc of the price point. But when they say you get what you pay for, that’s a fact! Here are my dislikes. Unlike Huggies, this package does not have a snap resealable. It simply has an adhesive. Which is not advantageous to keeping the wipe moist. The wipes do not come out one by one, the come out until you hold down the package to stop the flow, which is annoying balancing the package and a stinky pamper at the same time. What i do like is they aren’t scented as promise.
customer_reviews.author: MadameD

customer_reviews.title: “Subscribe and Save- Life saver in times of baby wipes crisis!!”
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy when this baby wipes arrived when there was crisis/shortage on wipes and toilet paper. now a days ! I had forgotten that I had a subscription on this. The quantity and the price of the baby wipes is unbeatable !!! I thank amazon for having this kind of program it really did save me with money and headache of where to get baby wipes in times like this. Thanks amazon you are the best:)
customer_reviews.author: Jessie D.

customer_reviews.title: A year later and I still love these diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this brand of diapers for my son since he was an infant. He is now 16 months and all over the place! These diapers are amazing. They don’t leak, they stay out while he walks, runs, climbs, you name it. We don’t have overnight leaks and they really hold up well. Even when he was an infant and had the liquid breast milk poop these past the test. He has very sensitive skin and has never had a reaction. This one box lasts us over a month!
customer_reviews.author: Momofboys

customer_reviews.title: Thin and packaging is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These wipes have really good reviews but these are my least favorite wipes! They are so thin and it’s really difficult to pull one out at a time since they overlap so much. When you’re cleaning up a poopie diaper and you need a wipe fast with one hand...it’s super annoying! Wouldn’t buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Rewards Already Redeemed
customer_reviews.text: The box was opened... none of the rewards worked. I only buy Pampers products because of their reward system and someone probably bought these and got all of the reward codes and returned! I’m so upset!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Not what it said...
customer_reviews.text: Love these wipes but not happy with what was delivered. The description says "8 Pampers Sensitive Pop-Top Packs (72 CT) and 4 Pampers Sensitive Refill Packs (72 CT)". I received 4 pop tops and 8 refill packs. Which would be fine it I had something to put the refill packs in, but I don't. Bunch of wasted wipes because I could keep the packs sealed and the wipes dried out.
customer_reviews.author: Yoster

customer_reviews.title: Packaging change is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: As others have recently said, the packaging change for these wipes (removal of the sticky quick-access opening on top of each package) is a terrible idea that was clearly thought of by the bean counters instead of the actual product designers. Pampers, your quality control team should of never passed this! 5/5 for wipe quality 0/5 for packaging
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good. Change please. Better materials.
customer_reviews.text: I should have known better after my two kids and going through wipes like goldfish snacks that these were not going to live up to the Pampers standard I thought had been established by their amazing diapers...I'm so dissapointed by these baby wipes. They are scratchy. They don't belong on the skin at all. I'm not sure why they say sensitive. My guess is that the fibers in them are plasticky because they feel just like scratchy acrylic yarn. Very sad...
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: They’re alright...
customer_reviews.text: They get the job done and don’t have harsh chemicals in them. The only downside is that I notice they sometimes leave a residue on my baby’s skin oddly enough.... Again, these are totally fine wipes but we have a preference for other wipes. I had to grab these during the start of the pandemic when people were making a run on baby wipes and I couldn’t pass it up.
customer_reviews.author: Steffanie

customer_reviews.title: Now impossible to open.
customer_reviews.text: Obviously whoever decided to change the packaging has never been elbow deep in baby poop and run out of wipes. They used to have a perforated top so you can grab a pack and open it with one hand. Now they are impossible to open without scissors. Switching to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Don't love these
customer_reviews.text: We decided to try these wipes because the other ones we were subscribed to weren't available for the time being. The individual packaging for these wipes doesn't re-close easily, it is just a sticky plastic piece. Then they get stuck together and several come out, when you just want one wipe. I also like using wipes to clean spit-up from my baby off of clothes and the floor and these wipes don't do as good of a job as other wipes, to clean it out of cloth. Besides that, they are soft on my babies bottom and smell fine.
customer_reviews.author: Britney Wilson

customer_reviews.title: The wipes are great, but the packaging not so much
customer_reviews.text: As far as the wipes go, they do a good job of cleaning my newborn, however the wipes aren't the only thing that is sensitive; the package tears extremely easily and the sticky closure loses sticky quickly, which causes the top wipes to dry out. I have tried to pull wipes out different ways to see if it helps, but of course when you have a newborn you sometimes have to grab wipes quickly, and no matter what it seems the package tears. If you keep them in a ziploc bag or place something over it, you can avoid drying out the wipes too fast. Other than the packaging the wipes do great.
customer_reviews.author: Karla Courville

customer_reviews.title: Variety pack?
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very quickly, but 4 of the wipe packages were slightly different in that they didn’t have the nice re-sealable door on the top. Still works, just a little less convenient. Not sure if this was a mistake or if they always come this way.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Frye

customer_reviews.title: One Of The Best
customer_reviews.text: These are the only wipes other than Huggies Natural Care & Water Wipes, that my son doesn’t break out in a rash from. They easily wipe up washable paints & markers too! Definitely multipurpose.
customer_reviews.author: April Burke

customer_reviews.title: Seal does not keep package closed!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I will never order this product again and am very disappointed that they don’t seal up and close! They end up drying out and therefor being unusable because the seal simply does not effectively close the package. Come on this is a major brand and not even a new product. families deserve better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Estridge

customer_reviews.title: Pour new packaging materials, but great product.
customer_reviews.text: With the heat and fire this came in dried up. The new packaging leaked some fluid on the box and shipping box. Not all were dried up just some. I loved pamper’s products just wish they didn’t use cheaper packaging this time. For those that are not dried up, this worked well on my baby. Pamper does the best when it comes to cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: karminmou

product_meta.title: Pampers Baby Wipes Sensitive Perfume Free 8X Refill Packs (Tub Not Included) 576 Count
product_meta.description: Size:576 Count (Pack of 1)Gentle cleaning for your baby’s sensitive skin Changing your baby can be one of the most loving moments of the day. The #1 choice of hospitals* and the #1 sensitive wipe,** Pampers Sensitive baby wipes are clinically proven mild, dermatologist-tested, hypoallergenic, and perfume-free. Their unique Softgrip Texture offers gentle cleaning for your baby’s sensitive skin. Plus Pampers Sensitive wipes are 20% thicker versus regular Pampers wipes. During changing time, give your baby our best gentle clean: Pampers Sensitive wipes. Makes up more than 97% of the base in the water-based cleansing formula. Used to improve the wipe's texture and provide wetness that enables gentle cleaning. *Based on hospital sales data **Based on U.S./Canada “Sensitive” nationally branded sales
feature_bullets: 576 Total Wipes in 8X or 9X Refill Packs
The No.1 Choice of Hospitals (based on hospital sales data)
The #1 Sensitive Wipe (based on U.S./Canada “Sensitive” nationally branded sales)
Helps restore pH of the skin
Zero percentage of Paraben, Alcohol, perfume and phenoxyethanol in this sensitive water based wipe

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
